author: lmat1
content: Would it be possible to develop a ERC-20 token that "resets" after a while? What would happen if a ERC-20 token cleared out all ownership and changed some parameters (like its name) without "changing" its address? I assume the usual tools don't rely on ERC-20 token balances and other properties staying constant, but that they check the properties on the block-chain when needed?

author: sky.cactus
content: You'll get a better answer at https://discord.gg/hSxj4w7a most likely.

author: sky.cactus
content: Short answer though is that you'll probably break a whole lot of stuff (like Uniswap).

author: lmat1
content: <@!301186049323958275> Thanks for the pointer! I'll take up the conversation there.

author: lmat1
content: That's actually why I joined this discord server. That one seems more pertinent!
